thread.title: College football: WVU-Baylor capsule
thread.title_full: College football: WVU-Baylor capsule - San Antonio Express-News

author: mysanantonio.com
title: College football: WVU-Baylor capsule
text:
West Virginia (3-2, 0-2)
at No. 2 Baylor (5-0, 2-0)
Kickoff: 11 a.m. today, McLane Stadium, Waco.
TV: Fox
Line: Baylor by 20
Series: WVU leads 2-1
Matchup: Baylor QB Seth Russell and the Bears’ explosive offense against WVU’s defense — The Bears lead the nation in scoring and total offense and have the nation’s best yard-per-play average. But they will be challenged by a pesky WVU defense that leads the nation with 13 interceptions, has allowed only six passing TDs and is the only Big 12 team to limit opponents to less than 50 percent completion percentage.
Players: WVU RB Wendell Smallwood — Became the first Mountaineer since 2010 with three consecutive 100-yard rushing games after matching his career high with 147 yards in last week’s overtime loss against Oklahoma State. Baylor WR Corey Coleman — The Biletnikoff Award contender leads the nation with 13 touchdowns receptions. It’s the most by a college player after five games since WVU’s Stedman Bailey had 13 in 2012.
WVU can win if: The Mountaineers provide a strong defensive effort to flummox Art Briles and the Bears — again.
Baylor can win if: The Bears steer away from the penalties that doomed them last season at WVU and have a typically big offensive effort.
Fun with numbers: Baylor has won its first eight games at McLane Stadium by an average of 34 points per game.
Tim Griffin
